review: Easy to set up, good selection of channels. I wish my TV had a powered HDMI so it didn't have to be plugged in. Kind of defeats the purpose of having a small device that hides behind your TV if it has to be plugged in and the cord always visible. Highly recommended, especially if your TV has a powered HDMI.
author: Mitch H

review: I bought the Roku because it supports the most streaming channels.  I love the hot buttons on the remote for prime and netflix.  The interface is well done and easy to use.The one big problem is won't connect to my 5ghz network.  It connects to my 2.4 just fine.  I opened a ticket with Roku and they started telling me I should try different channels on my router.  That made me angry because you should never build a product that requires someone to go in and change channels on their router.  I have many devices that connect just fine.  They told me I need to move it closer to the router.  The 5ghz range has a greater range then the 2.4ghz.  If it can connect to 2.4 so it should connect to 5 easy.  I've given up and I'll just have to live with the 2.4
author: Bruce Ziegler

review: The streaming stick set up very easily.  However the stick would not play any videos from any of the apps, including amazon prime.  I contacted customer support and they could not resolve the issue.  My wifi connection was perfect, but the roku would just say buffering when i tried to play videos.  I am returning this product and getting an amazon fire.
